intro: Manulea oppositiflora, commonly known as the opposite-flower manulea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its opposite arrangement of leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to certain regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has small, elliptical leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in forest understories and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
